title: Essentially finite vector bundle
summary: In mathematics, an essentially finite vector bundle is a particular type of vector bundle defined by Madhav V. Nori,[1][2] as the main tool in the construction of the fundamental group scheme.  Even if the definition is not intuitive there is a nice characterization that makes essentially finite vector bundles quite natural objects to study in algebraic geometry.
